hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Shock Recovery in STRESS Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a STRESS regime declaration (VIX >35, crypto volatility >120%), when BTC bid-ask spread narrows from >1% to <0.3% within 2 hours while price stabilizes within ±2% range, the first 1% move away from consolidation will continue another 2-4% in same direction with >65% probability as liquidity returns asymmetrically.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During stress events, liquidity providers withdraw completely. Their return is gradual and often directional—market makers test one side first. The initial breakout indicates which side liquidity is returning to first, creating short-term momentum.
entry_conditions: BTC bid-ask spread compresses from >1% to <0.3% within 2 hours
Price consolidates within ±2% range for minimum 1 hour post-compression
First 1% breakout from consolidation range occurs
Volume on breakout >50% higher than consolidation volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Additional 2-4% move in breakout direction (scale out)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses through consolidation range midpoint

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If liquidity return post-stress is consistently symmetric (both bid and ask simultaneously) rather than directional.
